page.title: 12ABBEY INTERNATIONAL, MALVERN
page.content: In 1978 this college moved from Cheltenham to the present{70 acre {site,}once home of the{Abbey Girls {School.}It has 94 students between 13 and 21 but will have 350 in 6 houses during the{Summer School.}There are 10 admin staff and 14 teachers who help the Far East and African students bridge the gap between their background and the West. Problems of {language, culture}and even{diet}have to be overcome before students can compete for the decreasing number of places offered to{overseas students}at UK universities. Thus the courses emphasise{English Language for {foreigners.}Recruitment is helped by the long tradition of education in the area and the spectacular views from the terraced site of the Severn Valley. It has a gym, outdoor heated swimming pool and 28 tennis courts.
